text: Genocides by the Soviet Union can refer to the following atrocities committed by the Soviet Union (1922–1991): * Holodomor, * * * * * * * * * * * a man- made famine (1932–33) under Joseph Stalin (1878–1953) that killed millions of Ukrainians * Soviet persecution of Poles during World War II * * * * ** Katyn massacre, * * * * * * mass executions of captured Polish soldiers, police and members of the intelligentsia * Soviet persecution of Baltic states' population * Dunsdorfs, Edgars.
